tweet: Business leader Gail Pittman launched her pottery company Gail Pittman, Inc., in Jackson. It was the largest manufacturer of hand-painted ceramics in the United States and she has licensed her designs to other manufacturers. #WomensHistoryMonth https://hottytoddy.com/2014/08/12/mississippis-gail-pittman-is-successful-artist-entrepreneur/ …

Bobbie Lee Gentry is an American singer-songwriter from Chickasaw County who was one of the first female music artists to compose & produce her own material. Her songs drew on her Mississippi roots & featured scenes from the South. #WomensHistoryMonth  http://www.mscountrymusictrail.org/markers/bobbie-gentry …

Eudora Welty is a Pulitzer Prize-winning author who was born in Jackson. She is well-known for her talents as a short story writer, novelist, and photographer. #WomensHistoryMonth  https://eudorawelty.org/biography/

Dr. Hannah Gay, a pediatrician and researcher at @UMMCNews, was named to TIME magazine’s 100 most influential people in the world for developing a breakthrough in HIV treatment for newborns. #WomensHistoryMonth http://libarts.olemiss.edu/hannah-gay/

The system of checks and balances established by the Founders has preserved our democracy. It is essential that we protect this balance even when it is frustrating or inconvenient.
For these reasons, I support my colleagues in looking for a way to advance President Trump's Border Security Plan while preserving the invaluable concept of separation of powers.

The precedent we set this year might empower a future liberal President to declare emergencies to enact gun control or to address ‘climate emergencies,’ or even to tear down the wall we are building today.

I commend the President for his efforts to secure our nation's border quickly. However, I have serious reservations as to what the Emergency Declaration might do to the Constitutional principle of checks and balances.

For over 20 years in the House and Senate, I have voted for funds to build more than 600 miles of border structure. The funds currently available to President Trump will allow our country to continue building the border wall in the near term.
